job description:
Bioinformatics Scientist - Primer Design in South San Francisco, CA at Volt

# Date Posted: _8/6/2018_

# Job Snapshot

+ **Employee Type:** Contingent

+ **Location:** South San Francisco, CA

+ **Job Type:** Scientific/Biotech

+ **Duration:** 36 weeks

+ **Date Posted:** 8/6/2018

+ **Job ID:** 128378

+ **Contact Name** Volt Branch

+ **Phone** 714-921-7460

# Job Description

Candidate will be responsible for primer design for the development of targeted sequencing panels, pipelines and algorithms for the next-gen DNA sequencing.

# Responsibilities:

+ Develop, maintain, and operate bioinformatics pipelines for assay design, data mining and analysis

+ Design assays for custom targeted sequencing panels for external and internal researchers

+ Understand the core scientific questions and design assays to best address these questions.

+ Collaborate closely with the molecular biologists, product management, sales, experimental researchers and other members of the Bioinformatics team

# Skills/Knowledge Requirements

+ Experience working and developing bioinformatics production systems.

+ **The following are also required:** hands-on experience with the relevant sequence analysis tools (e.g. Blast, Clustalw, bowtie, etc.)

+ The candidate must have experience in Perl / Python programming, shell scripting and SQL.

+ This position requires the knowledge and skills normally acquired through completion of a MS/PhD in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Genomics or related field. Three years of relevant working experience is required.
